item.description:
A great local spot with trails, a meadow, stream, and links to the Robert Frost trail if you're really adventurous. One of only two dog-friendly conservation areas in Amherst. Plan for about an hour and a half, maybe longer. See you then!

Note: Bug repellent is a really good idea. Also helpful to wear something on you feet that you don't mind getting wet.

DIRECTIONS:

Directions to Amhethyst Brook Conservation area, across from 1 Ward St, Amherst, MA 01002-1658

Starting from the Hampshire Mall, Route 9 (Russell Street), Hadley, MA
Total Time: 9 mins, Total Distance: 3.85 mi

Starting at 42.357771,-72.550360 (Hampshire Mall) on RUSSELL ST Route 9 East, Towards Amherst Center, travel 2.85 miles. (Note, Russell Street becomes Northampton Road, which then becomes College Street but the whole thing is still Route 9 East)

At the traffic light near Peoples Bank , turn Turn LEFT on SOUTH EAST ST, travel .56 miles

You will come to another traffic light. Turn RIGHT on MAIN ST/(which becomes Pelham Road); you will again be heading East.

Continue on PELHAM RD about 0.44 mi. You will see Ward Street on the right. The parking lot for Amethyst Brook Conservation Area is on the left, directly across from Ward Street.
item.how_to_find_us: I have a black lab w/blue leash, & white PT Cruiser

group.name: Western Mass Dogs - Walks and more!

item.name: Western Mass Dogs August Meetup-Amethyst Brook
